recipe.title: Quick Green Pasta
recipe.description: A fast, vibrant green pasta packed with spinach, peas, tenderstem broccoli, and Parmesan.

steps.instructions: Trim and slice the spring onions. Trim the leek, halve it lengthways, wash it, then finely slice. Finely slice the tenderstem broccoli stalks and reserve the tips.

on_enter.say: Let's start by prepping the veg: slice spring onions, leeks, and broccoli stalks.

steps.descr: Heat the pan over medium heat
steps.instructions: Place a large non-stick shallow casserole pan on a medium heat to warm up.

on_enter.say: Heat your large pan over medium heat.

steps.descr: Cook spring onions, leek, broccoli stalks and garlic
steps.instructions: Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan along with the spring onions, leeks and broccoli stalks. Peel and finely chop the garlic and add it to the pan.

on_enter.say: Add the veg to the pan with a tablespoon of olive oil and stir in the garlic.

steps.instructions: Add the frozen spinach and frozen peas to the pan, along with a pinch of sea salt and black pepper.

on_enter.say: Add the spinach and peas, plus a pinch of salt and pepper.

steps.descr: Cook greens until soft but not coloured
steps.instructions: Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring regularly, until the vegetables are soft, the spinach is fully defrosted, and nothing has taken on colour.

on_enter.say: Let the greens cook down until soft, stirring regularly.

steps.instructions: Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling salted water according to the packet instructions. Add the reserved broccoli florets for the last 2 minutes.

on_enter.say: Boil your pasta according to the packet and add the broccoli tips for the last 2 minutes.

steps.descr: Add pasta water and optionally blitz sauce
steps.instructions: Finely grate the Parmesan. Scoop out about 200ml of the pasta cooking water and pour it into the veg pan. Choose whether to keep the sauce chunky, blitz it smooth in a blender, or use a hand blender for a semi-smooth texture.

on_enter.say: Add a ladle of pasta water to the veg and choose your sauce texture—chunky or smooth.

steps.descr: Combine pasta with sauce and finish
steps.instructions: Drain the pasta and broccoli, then tip into the sauce. Add 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil and the grated Parmesan. Toss everything together until coated.

on_enter.say: Mix the pasta into the sauce with Parmesan and a little extra virgin olive oil.

steps.descr: Finish with herbs and extra Parmesan
steps.instructions: Finish with fresh herbs such as parsley or basil, and grate over a little extra Parmesan to serve. Enjoy with a big side salad if you like.

notes.leftovers_tip: This recipe serves 6 — leftover portions keep well for lunch the next day.
